awd_titl_txt: The Isotopic Signature of Upwelling in the Arabian Sea
awd_abstract_narration: The PI proposes to study the history of the Asian monsoon by                    looking at geologic parameters which are sensitive to the                       oceanographic effects of the monsoon such as: regional gradients                in the thermocline, sea-surface temperature, and upwelling                      intensity.  Foraminifera from sediment traps in the Arabian Sea                 will be used to monitor the isotopic and faunal response of the                 foraminifera to the monsoon-induced temperature changes.  The                   isotopic and faunal signal in the sediment trap results will be                 used to trace the geologic history of the monsoon in sedimentary                cores.  The PIs will concentrate on geologic periods thought to                 represent extremes in monsoon seasonality in order to monitor                   monsoonal history on glacial-interglacial time scales.
